location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: The map shows the docks built on the south bank of the Shatt-Al Arab at Margil [Al Ma‘qil], near Basra, Mesopotamia. Features and facilities (some labelled I.W.T. [Inland Water Transport]) shown on the map include:dock infrastructure, including shipping berths, wharves, water channels, depots and railway lines;various camps, including labour camps and prisoner-of-war camps, huts and tents, accommodation for ordnance personnel, stevedores’ camp;date gardens;villages;a Chinese cemetery, used for the burial of workers who were part of the Chinese Labour Corps;other sites, including a brick field and recreation area.In the bottom right corner of the map are two reproduced signatures, both are illegible. Above these signatures are two sets of initials: ‘I.E.F.D.’ (Indian Expeditionary Force D) and ‘P.A. & C.’
